intro: Hymenoxys richardsonii var. utahensis, commonly known as the Utah hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, aiding in water retention. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
